sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A declaration of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament, concerning the publishing of divers proclamations, and papers, in forms of proclamations in his Majesties name. England and Wales. Parliament.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed for Ed. Husbands, and Jo. Franck, London : 1642. July 6.
With an order to print signed: Hen. Elsing. Cler. Parl. D. Com. Ordered by the Lords and Commons: that no sheriff shall publish any proclamation, &c., contrary to any order, &c. of Parliament, but shall use all means to supress it. Sheriffs who have refused to publish them will be protected by Parliament. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A declaration of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament, concerning the publishing of divers proclamations, and papers, in forms of proclamations in his Majesties name. England and Wales. Parliament.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed for Ed. Husbands, and Jo. Franck, London : 1642. July 6.
With an order to print signed: Hen. Elsing. Cler. Parl. D. Com. Ordered by the Lords and Commons: that no sheriff shall publish any proclamation, &c., contrary to any order, &c. of Parliament, but shall use all means to supress it. Sheriffs who have refused to publish them will be protected by Parliament. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Ed. Husbands
Jo. Franck
